version_description:
With the excitement of Premium still buzzing through our veins, Update and I decide to leave his apartment and head for the theatre. I order us a bucket of popcorn and a chocolate malt to share.

“Ah, there’s nothing like watching a picture in technicolor,” I smile in awe.

“You got that right,” Update says, his eyes affixed to the screen. “Speaking of which, Premium users will now be able to unlock new themes in an array of colors.”

“Ooh, Like what?” I inquire.

“Colors ranging from the olive found in my famous martinis,” he says with a wink, and then he takes a slight pause, “to that extraordinary turquoise hue found in your eyes.”

Just when I think this world has dealt him one-too-many icy blows to the chest, Update knocks my expectations out of the park. Now it’s me who freezes as he takes my face in his hands and stares into my eyes so intensely I feel like I might dissolve into the dark sticky theatre floor. As his lips close in, there’s suddenly a loud “snap!” and the screen goes blank.

A faint but harsh silhouette remains on screen. Before Update can speak her name, Veronica’s shadow runs off the screen and the theatre door slams shut.

I turn to Update, who is grinning. “Everything alright?” I ask, concerned.

“Looks like our nemesis just found out about Wattpad Picks- a new category in Discover of curated stories straight from the Wattpad team,” he gleams, and then adds, “available for everyone”.

I take his hand in mine, “you’ve always got something up those sleeves of yours.”

He shoots a sly smile my way and takes a sip from our melting chocolate malt.

Leaving the movie theatre, Update and I decide to take the scenic route home and walk. Hand in hand, my head resting on Update’s shoulder through the near-empty streets, I know moments don’t get much better than this. Then, Update tells me to look up.

The blackness above us is freckled with glimmering stars as far as the eye can see.

Amazed, I stop in my tracks, “Wow, I can’t remember seeing the sky so lit up”.

“Isn’t that something,” Update says with an pure awe in his voice, “all those dots lighting up, from multiple galaxies,” he pauses. “Reminds me of how with the new tag rankings feature, Wattpad stories can now appear on multiple hot lists”.

In a star-lit trance, I respond, “More skies for those stories to shine in”. Just then, a shooting star appeared right over our heads like a fiery paint stroke.

“Did you see that?” Update asked with the excitement of a child. “Did you make a wish?”.

With a smirk on my face I whisper, “You bet I did, but it’s a little too 18+ to say on these streets, if you catch my drift,” I turned to him and winked.

Trying to regain his composure, Update clears his throat and coyly remarks, “Well, my dear, mature stories can now rank on Wattpad, so don’t be so shy about letting me know your wish.” Composure found.

I playfully remove Update’s tweed hat and place it on my head, “Now now, you know what happens when you say a wish out lo—“.

Suddenly in the bushes to our left, a loud rumbling…

“Did you see that?” Update asked with the excitement of a child. “Did you make a wish?”.

With a smirk on my face I whisper, “You bet I did, but it’s a little too 18+ to say on these streets, if you catch my drift,” I turned to him and winked.

Trying to regain his composure, Update clears his throat and coyly remarks, “Well, my dear, mature stories can now rank on Wattpad, so don’t be so shy about letting me know your wish.” Composure found.

I playfully remove Update’s tweed hat and place it on my head, “Now now, you know what happens when you say a wish out lo—“.

Suddenly in the bushes to our left, a loud rumbling…

Leaving the movie theatre, Update and I decide to take the scenic route home and walk. Hand in hand, my head resting on Update’s shoulder through the near-empty streets, I know moments don’t get much better than this. Then, Update tells me to look up.

The blackness above us is freckled with glimmering stars as far as the eye can see.

- Fixed not saving reading position in time

When our eyes adjust to the brightness, we realize it’s a pair of headlights in our view. Update approaches the lights to get a better look, but as he does the car screeches off and leaves us reeling in it’s dust.
“Who was that,” I start, waiting for the debris to settle.
Update puts his hands on his hips and finishes my thought, “and what were they doing parked in the middle of the road?”.
As the mysterious circumstances wash over us, a dusty flyer lands on Update’s loafer. He picks it up, reads it, and walks over to show me:
International Film Festival showcasing directors from Canada, the United Kingdom, Mexico, and the Philippines

The gears in his head start to turn. “Not a bad idea,” Update says with a look of excitement. “Wattpad users have been asking for a way to support writers’ careers for a while now. Maybe it’s time to test out those waters”.

“Sounds great, but how exactly would the readers help fund writer’s careers?” I ask.

“Well, just like this film festival, we could have selected stories that audiences can pay to experience. They could unlock a story chapter by chapter,” he says.

“Or,” I add, “they can choose to purchase the whole story to binge all at once”.

Update nods in delighted agreement.

“And we could use some sort of virtual currency. It’s all the rage I hear,” he says, quoting the air like it’s going out of style.

I quietly giggle Update’s attempt at being hip and with it. Somehow it only makes me swoon deeper for him. He puts his arm around my shoulders, “Virtual currency, what a time to be alive.”

“So where are you going to test this brilliant idea,” I ask, taking the flyer out of the warm hand resting on my shoulder.

He waits a beat and then points at the flyer, “if this isn’t a sign then I don’t know what is,” he smirks. “Canada, the United Kingdom, Mexico, and the Philippines, get ready for what’s Next.

Startled by a noise in the bushes, I pull closer to Update.

“Update, I’m scared…” I find comfort in Update’s solid, dependable embrace.

“Do you want me to walk you home?” Update asks.

I hesitate, pulling away, “I would...but sometimes home is unreliable…”

Update nods knowingly, “Just like Wattpad homepage used to be. But now the homepage loads with no problem,” Update looks deep into my eyes and I can see myself reflected in their depths, “Just like our home will be, one day…”

We stand there, lost in the enjoyable dream of a possible future together, when the moment is broken by a large, bumbling raccoon bursting out of the bush beside us.

It looks up at us with beady, accusatory eyes, as though we were interrupting its moment, then scurries away.

Update and I share a laugh, but then I frown.

“What was I saying? I’ve lost my place in our conversation. I guess we need to start at the beginning again…”

Update shoots me a sly grin, “Not at all. I know that used to happen sometimes, both in life AND in Wattpad stories, but now your reading position is saved and doesn’t boot you back to the start of a chapter...just like I saved our place in the conversation. We were talking about - “

But before Update can finish, there is a bright light that draws both of our attention to the horizon…

“Wait, is that…?!”
- Bug fixes and upgrades for a smoother reading experience

You can purchase Coins and redeem to read Wattpad Next beta stories
Bug fixes and upgrades for a smoother reading experience

We believe we have fixed the homepage failed to load bug
A bug where your reading position doesn't save and you get booted to the start of a chapter
Updated the look and feel of the Premium modal
General improvements and bug fixes

Startled by a noise in the bushes, I pull closer to Update.

“Update, I’m scared…” I find comfort in Update’s solid, dependable embrace.

“Do you want me to walk you home?” Update asks.

I hesitate, pulling away, “I would...but sometimes home is unreliable…”

Update nods knowingly, “Just like Wattpad homepage used to be. But now the homepage loads with no problem,” Update looks deep into my eyes and I can see myself reflected in their depths, “Just like our home will be, one day…”

We stand there, lost in the enjoyable dream of a possible future together, when the moment is broken by a large, bumbling raccoon bursting out of the bush beside us.

It looks up at us with beady, accusatory eyes, as though we were interrupting its moment, then scurries away.

Update and I share a laugh, but then I frown.

“What was I saying? I’ve lost my place in our conversation. I guess we need to start at the beginning again…”

Update shoots me a sly grin, “Not at all. I know that used to happen sometimes, both in life AND in Wattpad stories, but now your reading position is saved and doesn’t boot you back to the start of a chapter...just like I saved our place in the conversation. We were talking about - “

But before Update can finish, there is a bright light that draws both of our attention to the horizon…

“Wait, is that…?!”

When our eyes adjust to the brightness, we realize it’s a pair of headlights in our view. Update approaches the lights to get a better look, but as he does the car screeches off and leaves us reeling in its dust.
“Who was that,” I start, waiting for the debris to settle.
Update puts his hands on his hips and finishes my thought, “and what were they doing parked in the middle of the road?”
As the mysterious circumstances wash over us, a dusty flyer lands on Update’s loafer. He picks it up, reads it, and walks over to show me:
International Film Festival showcasing directors from Canada, the United Kingdom, Mexico, and the Philippines.

The gears in his head start to turn. “Not a bad idea,” Update says with a look of excitement. “Wattpad users have been asking for a way to support writers’ careers for a while now. Maybe it’s time to test out those waters”.

“Sounds great, but how exactly would the readers help fund writer’s careers?” I ask.

“Well, just like this film festival, we could have selected stories that audiences can pay to read. They could unlock a story chapter by chapter.” he says.

“Or,” I add, “they can choose to purchase the whole story to binge all at once.”

Update nods in delighted agreement.

“And we could use some sort of virtual currency. It’s all the 'rage' I hear,” he says, quoting the air like it’s going out of style.

He waits a beat and then points at the flyer, “If this isn’t a sign then I don’t know what is,” he smirks. “Canada, the United Kingdom, Mexico, and the Philippines, get ready for what’s Next.
